comment.text: A cerebroside 3-sulfate + H(2)O = a cerebroside + sulfate.
Inhibited by phosphate. The phosphate forms a covalent bond with the active site 3-oxoalanine.

Homodimer at neutral pH and homooctamer at acidic pH. Exists both as a single chain of 58 kDa (component A) or as a chain of 50 kDa (component B) linked by disulfide bond(s) to a 7 kDa chain (component C). Interacts with SUMF1.

The conversion to 3-oxoalanine (also known as C-formylglycine, FGly), of a serine or cysteine residue in prokaryotes and of a cysteine residue in eukaryotes, is critical for catalytic activity. This post-translational modification is severely defective in multiple sulfatase deficiency (MSD).

disease.name: Leukodystrophy metachromatic
disease.description: A leukodystrophy due to a lysosomal storage defect. Characterized by intralysosomal storage of cerebroside-3-sulfate in neural and non-neural tissues, with a diffuse loss of myelin in the central nervous system. Progressive demyelination causes a variety of neurological symptoms, including gait disturbances, ataxias, optical atrophy, dementia, seizures, and spastic tetraparesis. Three forms of the disease can be distinguished according to the age at onset: late-infantile, juvenile and adult.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Multiple sulfatase deficiency
disease.description: A clinically and biochemically heterogeneous disorder caused by the simultaneous impairment of all sulfatases, due to defective post-translational modification and activation. It combines features of individual sulfatase deficiencies such as metachromatic leukodystrophy, mucopolysaccharidosis, chondrodysplasia punctata, hydrocephalus, ichthyosis, neurologic deterioration and developmental delay.

comment.text: The protein represented in this entry is involved in disease pathogenesis. Arylsulfatase A activity is impaired in multiple sulfatase deficiency due to mutations in SUMF1 (PubMed:15146462). SUMF1 mutations result in defective post-translational modification of ARSA at residue Cys-69 that is not converted to 3-oxoalanine (PubMed:7628016).
The metal cofactor was first identified as magnesium ion, based on the structure of the recombinant protein, but when purified from human placenta, the protein contains 1 calcium ion per subunit.

feature.description: In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to 5% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs199476339.
In MLD; infantile-onset; causes a severe reduction of enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs199476346.
In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to 2.4% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs199476340.
In MLD; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs199476357.
In MLD; severe; no enzyme residual activity; leads to a decreased stability of the mutant enzyme; causes an arrest of the mutant enzyme polypeptide in a prelysosomal compartment; dbSNP:rs74315460.
In MLD; severe; no enzyme residual activity; dbSNP:rs199476371.
In MLD; severe late-infantile type; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs74315462.
In MLD; significantly lower activity than wild-type protein; dbSNP:rs199476358.
In MLD; juvenile/adult-onset; generates 5% as much activity as the parallel normal control; dbSNP:rs199476373.
In MLD; late-infantile form; no enzyme residual activity; dbSNP:rs199476377.
In MLD; adult type; enzyme activity reduced to 50% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs199476348.
In MLD; no enzyme residual activity; dbSNP:rs199476372.
In MLD; juvenile-onset; results in higly reduced enzyme activity and stability; the mutant enzyme is kept in a prelysosomal compartment; dbSNP:rs199476345.
In MLD; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs199476341.
In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to 15.6% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs148403406.
In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to less than 1% of normal activity; dbSNP:rs199476383.

In MLD; late-infantile form; no enzyme residual activity; leads to a decreased stability of the mutant enzyme; causes an arrest of the mutant enzyme polypeptide in a prelysosomal compartment; dbSNP:rs80338819.
In MLD; severe; 35% of normal activity; dbSNP:rs74315472.
In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to 0.6% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs199476342.
In MLD; adult type; causes a severe reduction of enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs199476349.
In MLD; juvenile-onset; causes a severe reduction of enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs199476347.
In MLD; late-infantile form; complete loss of enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs199476389.

In MLD; late-infantile-onset; enzyme activity reduced to less than 1%; the mutant protein is more rapidly degraded in lysosomes; strongly interferes with the octamerization process of the enzyme at low pH; dbSNP:rs74315484.
In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to 2.8% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs199476343.
In MLD; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs199476359.
In MLD; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs199476360.

In MLD; late-infantile-onset; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs74315475.
Associated with arylsulfatase A pseudodeficiency; unknown pathological significance; no effect on protein abundance; loss of N-glycosylation; dbSNP:rs2071421.
In MLD; severe; no enzyme residual activity; dbSNP:rs74315476.
In MLD; enzyme activity reduced to 4.7% of wild-type enzyme; dbSNP:rs199476344.
In MLD; late-infantile and juvenile-onset; dbSNP:rs74315480.
In MLD; loss of enzymatic activity; dbSNP:rs199476361.

In MLD; juvenile-onset; retains about 12% of specific enzyme activity; the mutant protein is unstable; results in more rapid enzyme degradation in lysosomes; addition of the cysteine protease inhibitor leupeptin increases the amount of the enzyme activity; displays a modest reduction in the octamerization process of the enzyme at low pH; dbSNP:rs74315485.
In MLD; juvenile/adult-onset; mild; common mutation; dbSNP:rs28940893.
